citation.article-title: Sphingopyxis marina sp. nov. and Sphingopyxis litoris sp. nov., isolated from seawater.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sphingopyxis marina sp. nov.
Sphingopyxis marina (ma.ri′na. L. fem. adj. marina of the sea, marine).
Colonies are circular, convex and yellow in colour and 0.7–1.0 mm in diameter after cultivation for 6 days at 30 °C on MA.
Does not grow without sea salts.
Does not grow under anaerobic conditions on MA or MA supplemented with nitrate.
Tyrosine is hydrolysed, but Tween 80, starch, xanthine, hypoxanthine and casein are not.
Positive reactions are obtained for arginine dihydrolase, urease, protease and the assimilation of glucose, arabinose, adipate, malate and citrate.

With API ZYM, positive reactions are obtained for alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase and trypsin, weakly positive reactions are obtained for esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and negative reactions are obtained for α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.
Sphingoglycolipid is present as the major polar lipid.
Spermidine and agmatine are present as major polyamine compounds, whereas cadaverine, putrescine and spermine are detected only in small amounts.
The type strain, FR1087T (=IMSNU 14132T=KCTC 12763T=JCM 14161T), was isolated from surface seawater collected off Jeju Island, Republic of Korea.
